summary: This is a brief email exchange between defense attorney Roy Black and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding scheduling a discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein matter. It indicates ongoing legal communication about the case in July 2008.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: The recipient of an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney seeking to schedule a discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein matter. He responds that he is out of town.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the legal matter to be discussed between Roy Black and the Assistant U.S. Attorney.

connections.description: Roy Black is being contacted to discuss the Epstein legal matter, indicating he is likely acting as or being considered as defense counsel for Epstein.

events.title: Scheduling Discussion on Epstein Matter
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails defense attorney Roy Black to schedule a discussion about the Jeffrey Epstein case. Black replies that he is out of town.

locations.context: Office address of the Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: As of July 30, 2008, an Assistant U.S. Attorney was actively seeking to discuss the Jeffrey Epstein matter with defense attorney Roy Black.
Roy Black, a prominent defense attorney, was involved in or being consulted on the Epstein case at this time.
The communication indicates the Epstein criminal investigation or prosecution was active and involved scheduling discussions between prosecution and defense counsel.
